root: ^Come in, please. What brings you here?"
^Good day, Detective White. I'm Captain Bennett of the ship you're currently aboard.
^A pleasure, Captain Bennett. Please have a seat. Now, what seems to be the issue?
^It's quite unfortunate, but we've had an accident onboard. One of our stewards, Rachel Palmer, was found dead.
^That's a grave matter indeed. Can you describe the situation?
^It seems Miss Palmer might have fallen down a staircase during the storm we had last night. It was quite chaotic, hard to see.
^I see, it's never easy losing a crew member. Did anyone witness the incident?
^No, not as far as we know. That's why we believe it to be an accident.
^A tragic incident, indeed. Rest assured, Captain, I will look into this matter right away.

root.#: layout: leftThere may be more than meets the eye.

c-0: ^Interesting, Captain. Yet, I must ask - how is it you came to seek me out for such an inquiry?
^I've heard about your work, Detective White. You have a certain reputation for... unraveling the intricate, shall we say.
^Ah, my reputation precedes me. But specifically, how did you come to know about me?
^An old friend, Constable Harris from the Metropolitan Police. He mentioned your name in high regard when we were discussing a different case a while back.
^Harris, indeed? He is a good man, knows his craft well. So, you've brought me a case that appears as an accident but your instincts say otherwise?
^Precisely, Detective. There's a foul air about the whole matter that I can't quite put my finger on. But I trust you can.
c-1: ^Very well, Captain. Now, enlighten me about this vessel of yours.
^She's a grand dame, sir. The SS Majestic, one of the largest transatlantic steamships of our time.
^The SS Majestic, indeed a worthy name. How many souls does she carry?
^About a thousand passengers and two hundred crew on a full voyage, Detective.
^A small floating city, isn't it? Now, tell me about the kind of passengers she carries. Any notable ones?

^Yes, the Majestic attracts a wide variety of passengers. Wealthy families, business moguls, even dignitaries. On this particular journey, we have the Jenkins family onboard, led by Thomas Jenkins, a rather influential merchant.
^Thomas Jenkins... I've heard that name before. Any others?
^None that immediately spring to mind, Detective. But the Jenkins family is accompanied by a number of associates and employees.
^Sounds like a crowd. I will need the passenger manifest and the crew list, Captain.
^Of course, Detective. I will have them sent to your room at once.
c-2: ^Now, about the crime scene. Any peculiarities?
^At first glance, nothing out of the ordinary. A flight of stairs, a poor woman who seemingly lost her footing in the storm.
^Phillip Anderson, sir. He's the assistant to Mr. Jenkins, the merchant.
^I see. And what was Mr. Anderson's state when he found the body?
^Seemed truly shocked, sir. He immediately called for help.
^Quite so. And the area has been secured, I trust?
^Indeed, Detective. No one's been allowed in or out since it was discovered.
^Excellent. Now, I believe it's high time I visited this scene myself, Captain Bennett.
